cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi (115 km) SSE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northwest across the Lower Florida Keys, skirt up the west coast of Florida Sunday night–Monday, then curve inland across southwest and central Georgia and into Alabama by late Tuesday–Wednesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Lower Florida Keys (near Key West, FL)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Fernandina Beach FL to Edisto Beach SC (includes GA coast and Port of Savannah)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning: North of Fernandina Beach FL to South Santee River SC; Storm-surge warning: South Santee River SC southward to Jupiter Inlet FL (includes GA coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through Georgia into South Carolina, with greatest surge threat from South Santee River SC to Fernandina Beach FL
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, higher gusts) possible Monday, with a 26 % peak probability.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft inundation possible along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain forecast over southeast Georgia with potential flash flooding in the Savannah area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous surf/rip currents could disrupt port operations.
